Initiative                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              China Initiative   The explosive growth of China and its reverberations around the world are affecting all areas of business. These developments present business scholars with important new research questions and opportunities. Through school-wide workshops and broader community engagement, the China Initiative seeks to foster and disseminate research on business and China in all disciplines. Take "Doing Business in… China" Course  — June 2, 2012        MBA student Pui Chi Wong shares photos from NYU Stern's "Doing Business in... China" course.                             "The cultural experiences, classroom discussions and company visits in the DBi China curriculum enriched my understanding of the current business, economic and political environment in Beijing," explains Pui Chi Wong. "The program exposed me to the opportunities, challenges and realities of doing business in China, and the experience has influenced how I will approach conducting business abroad." Take "Doing Business in… China" Course  — May 25, 2014                          In May, a group of MBA students traveled to Beijing for the Spring 2014 "Doing Business in... China" course. Highlights of the trip included corporate visits to Beijing Hyundai and CreditEase as well as lectures on corporate behavior, capital markets and the economy in China.    "The DBi to Beijing was an unforgettable adventure and certainly a highlight of my MBA,” said MBA student Elizabeth Frederick. “The academic, professional and social activities were a great way for us to experience the Chinese culture and business climate – and the personal and professional connections I gained were invaluable. It was exciting to learn about the rising importance of China while exploring such a dynamic city. Needless to say, the diversity of experience (and food!) made this one of my favorite courses at Stern."
